miknn 1.0
  • Reference

Mutual Information Calculation

mi_knn.Rd

Mutual Information Calculation

mi_knn(dt, var.d, var.c, k = NULL, warnings = TRUE, FORCE = TRUE,
  global = TRUE, quite = FALSE)

Arguments

dt

a data.frame object
var.d

the name of the discrete variable in quotations
var.c

the name of the continuouse variable in quotations
k

the number of neighbors for MI calculation.
warnings

set to FALSE to hide warnings
FORCE

set to TRUE continues despite not using an optimum k
global

set to FALSE to get specific MI
quite

set to TRUE to prevent messages being displayed to the console

Examples

library(miknn)

#TCGA data
data("gene_exp",package = "miknn")
gene_exp
#>          project                           id      CCND1  gene_zero
#>     1:  TCGA-GBM TCGA-02-0047-01A-01R-1849-01  27087.809    0.00000
#>     2:  TCGA-GBM TCGA-02-0055-01A-01R-1849-01  22992.089  566.27418
#>     3:  TCGA-GBM TCGA-02-2483-01A-01R-1849-01   2826.011    0.00000
#>     4:  TCGA-GBM TCGA-02-2485-01A-01R-1849-01   3788.464    0.00000
#>     5:  TCGA-GBM TCGA-02-2486-01A-01R-1849-01 104858.883   93.58593
#>    ---                                                             
#> 11089: TCGA-LIHC TCGA-ZS-A9CG-01A-11R-A37K-07   9627.674    0.00000
#> 11090: TCGA-THYM TCGA-ZT-A8OM-01A-11R-A42S-07  24860.055 2234.11516
#> 11091: TCGA-CHOL TCGA-ZU-A8S4-01A-11R-A41I-07  71944.870  343.52261
#> 11092: TCGA-CHOL TCGA-ZU-A8S4-11A-11R-A41I-07   8165.676    0.00000
#> 11093: TCGA-CESC TCGA-ZX-AA5X-01A-11R-A42T-07  26487.175  128.18321

# basic example using k = 10
mi_knn(dt = gene_exp, var.d = "project", k = 10, var.c = "CCND1")
#> Error in .kVector(get(var.c), k): object '_miknn_kVector' not found

# the function can decide the optimum k
mi_knn(dt = gene_exp, var.d = "project", var.c = "CCND1")
#> Using k = 20
#> Error in .kVector(get(var.c), k): object '_miknn_kVector' not found

# set global = FALSE to get the specific MI for each levels,  
mi_knn(dt = gene_exp, var.d = "project", var.c = "CCND1", global = FALSE)
#> Using k = 20
#> Error in .kVector(get(var.c), k): object '_miknn_kVector' not found

# generating a plot for specific MI
res <- mi_knn(dt = gene_exp, var.d = "project", var.c = "CCND1", global = FALSE)
#> Using k = 20
#> Error in .kVector(get(var.c), k): object '_miknn_kVector' not found
plot(res)
#> Error in plot(res): object 'res' not found
